think_procedure: To determine whether the 'log_checkpoints' knob in PostgreSQL is a 'special knob', I need to understand what values this knob can take and how these values affect its behavior. The 'log_checkpoints' parameter in PostgreSQL can be either set to on (1) or off (0). When set to on, PostgreSQL logs each checkpoint and restart point to the server log, which is useful for monitoring and tuning the database. When set to off, these events are not logged. Since the values 0 and 1 simply toggle the logging behavior and do not introduce any additional special functionality or break the natural order in a way that changes the fundamental operation of the system, it does not qualify as a 'special knob'.
